label: Description
value: Pair of suspenders of heavy silk mesh. Embroidered in colored silks in a vine design with small Chinese figures. Lined with magenta and white plaid taffeta. White leather straps and points to fashion to trousers.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, leather Technique: counted stitch embroidery

label: Description
value: Woven openwork band of linen cord wound with pink silk and edged with pink chenille. Multicolored silk floss flower cluster stitched on at intervals, each topped with a rosette of broad membrane strips wound with pink silk, with blue silk and metal flower in the middle.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 66 x 9 cm (26 in. x 3 9/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Tall man's cap of brilliant yellow silk embroidered with floral vines in silver metallic yarns. Lower edge turns up in the bicorne style.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic (metal-wrapped silk-core yarn) Technique: embroidered in satin and stem stitches on plain weave foundation Label: silk embroidered in metallic yarns in satin and stem stitches

label: Description
value: Man's nightcap with a rounded crown and turned-up brim. The fabric has a green silk satin ground with a woven pattern of flowers and arabesques in cream silk. The brim uses a different section of the same fabric, patterned with rabbits, fruit, trees, and addorsed birds.  Touches of salmon and silver embroidery accent both areas.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic (silver metal foil wound onto white silk core) Technique: two interconnected structures of 4\1 satin and plain weave (lampas), embroidered in surface satin stitch Label: silk lampas, embroidered with silk and metallic yarns

label: Description
value: Cap of cream white cotton, made in four conical sections. Seams stitched in silver thread, joined at top with metal tassel. Embroidered with small-scale flower sprays in blue, white, and metal thread. Cuff embroidered in symmetrical pattern of pomegranate and foliage sprays.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, linen, silk, metallic Technique: embroidery

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 30 cm (11 13/16 in.) folded

label: Description
value: Cap of coral silk with a chenille tassel in the same color. Knit with altnernating bands in a simple goemetric patterns.

label: Description
value: Close fitting skull cap of pink silk net. Embroidered in pink silks. Very long elaborate tassel of strands of chenille in coral pink, made into a group of strands.

label: Description
value: Dark red knitted silk cap with diagonally ribbed body, and crown with a star-shaped area of varied knitting patterns. With very long ornament of silk cords and chenille, forming three lozenge shapes and terminating in two tassels.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: knitted cap, knotted tassel Label: Knitted silk with knotted chenille tassel

label: Description
value: Sheer square with embroidered border of alternating up and down repeat of floral sprays and basket. Larger basket with flowering sprays set inside this border at each corner. In multicolored pastel silks, tarnished silver thread. Scalloped edge embroidered in green silk.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk or pineapple fiber, metallic thread (silver metal on yellow silk core) Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value: Horizontal border of white cotton printed in red. Broken scroll design of Rococo character forming uneven frames for flower clusters.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved plate on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 223 x 33 cm (7 ft. 3 13/16 in. x 13 in.) Repeat H (straight): 83.8 cm (33 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1951: Richard Cranch Greenleaf collection; 1951: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Bodice quilted in trapunto style in allover vine and flower design. V-shaped section in front, decorated with fleur-de-lys with pointed vines. Border around neck and sleeves. Fastens at back.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: trapunto quilting on plain weave

label: Description
value: Woven openwork linen band wound with pink and white silk. Green silk floss foliage band down the center, dotted with buds of ribbon in shades of pink, white, dark purple and red.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 226 x 5 cm (7 ft. 5 in. x 1 15/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Long strip, widening toward the bottom, of openwork effect formed by silk-wound linen strands bound at intervals by silk warps. Serpentine of green ribbon tied to form small scallops applied to it with accenting silk floss flowers. Scalloped edges of chenille.

label: Description
value: Diamond-shaped openwork band of loosely chained blue cords sewn with serpentines of colored knotted silk floss. Floral pompom of silk floss and silk cord centered in each scallop. Edging in scalloped white chenille.

label: Description
value: Buds and flowers made of ribbons and silk floss fastened closely to linen cord.

label: Description
value: Lace band with floss flowers sewn at intervals. Loosely worked undyed silk bobbin lace with a scalloped edge dotted with single flowers and a few small knotted tassels of polychrome silk floss sewn at regular intervals.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: bobbin lace with polychrome flower

label: Description
value: Pleated fan. Gilded paper leaf with hand-colored lithograph. Obverse: rustic fisherpeople against a landscape with water, and scrolling gold borders. Sticks are sandalwood with pierced designs and inlaid steel discs. Brass ball with silk and metal thread tassel.

label: Physical description
value: Gilded paper leaf with hand-colored lithograph, sandalwood sticks, pierced and inlaid with steel discs, brass ball with silk and metallic tassel

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1951: Mrs. Henry Woodward Haynes; 1951: acquired by the Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Henry Woodward Haynes

label: Description
value: Pleated fan. Metallic net leaf backed with black chiffon. Obverse: decorated with bands and diamonds of black sequins and paillettes sewn on taffeta as well as metal net. Carved sandalwood and pierced sticks.

label: Physical description
value: Metallic net leaf backed with silk, embroidered with sequins and paillettes, carved and pierced sandalwood sticks

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1951: Mrs. Henry Woodward Haynes; 1951: acquired by the Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Henry Woodward Haynes

label: Description
value: Brisé cockade fan. Sticks and guards are of black vulcanized rubber, drilled with an open design of delicate vines and flowers and a scalloped edge. Guards are attached to center of two outer sticks, all of which, threaded with ribbon. Spread to make a round form.

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1951: Mrs. Henry Woodward Haynes; 1951: acquired by the Museum.

value: Gift of Mrs. Henry Woodward Haynes

value: Brisé cockade fan. Sticks and guards are of black vulcanized rubber, drilled with an open design of delicate vines and flowers and a scalloped edge. Guards are attached to center of two outer sticks, all of which, threaded with ribbon. Spread to make a round form.

value: Small off-white fragment with two brown stripes on either side. The central off-white stripe is printed with a flower spray and leaf in red, blue, yellow and black. A very fine trailing vine in brown picotage forms the background pattern.

value: Medium: cotton Technique: block printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: Small rectangular fragment in off-white with a trailing vine, morning glory and rose in red, blue, purple and black.

value: Medium: cotton Technique: block printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: Folding oblong needle case made of seven different printed cottons; four pockets, one with a piece of wool for needles. In one pocket a small semicircle of newspaper dated 1838.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique: printed fabrics, stitched

label: Description
value: Two fragments printed in red on cream ground showing designs known as the “Four Quarters of the Globe.” Fragment A shows the full breadth of the allegorical figure“Afrique”. Fragment B shows part of “L’Asie”.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1951: Miss Frances Morris collection; 1951: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Long, pieced panel from the Directoire period with symmetrical design of bouquet of flowers, seated cupids, and a pendant frame surrounded by peacock feathers and enclosing addorsed birds on either side of palm tree. White raw silk in twill on pale turquoise satin ground horizontally ribbed from thick wefts. Pink and white striped satin selvages with four-cord edges.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: satin and twill weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 107 x 55 cm (42 1/8 x 21 5/8 in.)

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, cotton Technique: slit tapestry

label: Description
value: Square doily of piña cloth with brocaded pattern of floral motifs around a center circle.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: piña (pineapple) fiber Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft

label: Description
value: Square of piña cloth edged with wide border of floral motifs and a straight border in blue running along all four sides.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: piña (pineapple) fiber, silk (?) Technique: plain weave with supplementary weft

label: Description
value: Long cotton sarong (kain panjang) featuring diagonal repeat of medium-sized decorated blade-like motifs with stylized leaves and flowers attached to curving stems alternating with small four-lobed rosettes in dark blue, white, and cocoa brown. Design on a ground of cocoa crackle and five dark wavy parallel comb marks. Two plain selvedges, narrow hem at one end. Reversible.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave

label: Description
value: Skull cap with flat circular crown, band around the head, of double thickness of undyed linen with embroidered, couched, and quilted decoration. Diamonds around headband with various fillings in forms of herringbone stitch; double guard strips at top and bottom enclosing what may be Islamic inscriptions. Crown divided into four irregular squares containing illegible motifs in forms of herringbone. In natural and blue linen, blue and yellow, pink silk thread; thick bunches of black silk floss caught down by linen thread around borders and crossing crown of hat.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, silk, wool Technique: embroidered and quilted plain weave

label: Description
value: Section of coarse undyed linen cloth with small-scale allover pattern of triangles set side-by-side in diagonal rows, some filled with crosses, some filled with counted darning stitch. In dark brown, blue-green, and rust-red wools. One plain selvage.

label: Description
value: Section of undyed linen cloth with three parallel bands extending partially across it with interlocked continuous reserved scrolls on dark blue silk cross-stitch ground, red cross-stitch guard bands with small trefoil reserves.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, silk Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value: Undyed linen cloth crossed with two parallel bands with stemmed heart forms in blue silk cross-stitch on tan silk chain-stitch and stem-stitch ground; dark brown silk cross-stitch guard borders. One plain selvage with double warps. Narrow hand hem on opposite side.

label: Description
value: Fragment of linen with large eight-pointed floral rosette in silk chain stitch, with orange outline and with dark blue petals and center outlined within this. Set close to border of double row of dark blue chain-stitch. Plain selvage turned under this and hand-hemmed.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, silk Technique: chain stitch embroidery on plain weave

label: Description
value: Fragmentary square of linen cloth crossed horizontally by band with angular S-shapes wiht forced ends reserved on red cross-stitch ground; blue guard strips. Indication of plaided filed on one side of band: blue cross-stitch lines running at right angles to band, red cross-stitch line to it, forming squares.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, silk Technique: cross stitch embroidery on plain weave

label: Description
value: Dark blue silk cloth crossed at half inch intervals by bands of geometric repeats with guard bands above and below formed by pale yellow, pale blue and black wefts. One plain selvage, at right angles to bands, terminating in pale yellow silk cord.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain compound cloth

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 39.2 x 30.5 cm (15 7/16 in. x 12 in.)

value: Horizontal rectangular piece showing upper right-hand section of large pearl-bordered roundel curving over one bird head (duck or flamingo?) with bunch of grapes suspended from bill (complete roundel probably contained confronted birds on either side of Tree of Life) in undyed cotton on rust-red wool ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, cotton Technique: plain compound weft twill
